repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Error thrown for invalid line number which may be accessed
          in an `on_detach` callback at which point line count is
          intentionally set to 0.
Solution: Move empty memline check to before line number check.

Fix #31251
Fix #32349

comment_data.body: usually `n.expect_exit()` is needed when actively quitting the current test Nvim instance. should we do that here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,6 +305,19 @@ describe('lua buffer event callbacks: on_lines', function()
     n.assert_alive()
   end)
 
+  it('no invalid lnum error for closed memline in on_detach #31251', function()
+    exec_lua([[
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(0, 0, -1, false, { '' })
+      local bufname = 'buf2'
+      local buf = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_name(buf, bufname)
+      vim.bo[buf].bufhidden = 'wipe'
+      vim.cmd('vertical diffsplit '..bufname)
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_attach(0, false, { on_detach = function() vim.cmd("redraw") end})
+      vim.cmd.quit()

comment_data.body:
to ensure the test is "alive" should we assert that `on_detach` was actually called, e.g.

```
      eq(false, n.fn.exists('did_detach'))

      ...

      vim.api.nvim_buf_attach(0, false, { on_detach = function()
        vim.g.did_detach = true
        vim.cmd("redraw")
      end})

      ...

      eq(true, n.fn.exists('did_detach'))
```

comment_data.body:
The Nvim instance isn't closed here, just one of two split windows. Could change it to `vim.cmd.wincmd('q')` to make that more apparent. 

(Oh I haden't seen zeertzjq's and your comments above before posting this).

comment_data.body: Does `vim.cmd.close()` not have the required behavior?

comment_data.body: Yes, but test code can get stale, or refactored, so it's always good to assert that they are actually doing what was originally assumed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,6 +305,19 @@ describe('lua buffer event callbacks: on_lines', function()
     n.assert_alive()
   end)
 
+  it('no invalid lnum error for closed memline in on_detach #31251', function()

comment_data.body:
Yes that also works, `:close` being the same as `:quit` except when closing the last window. But actually we are testing deleting the buffer, so I'll update it to `:bdelete`. 

The `quit()` was just copying the repro from #31251.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_regular_data.body: Could be submitted as a Vim patch first but I don't think the problem can manifest there.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(memline): don't check line count for closed memline
